subject: Personal Finance
title: Why a Little Inflation Is Good
description: A quick, practical guide to Why a Little Inflation Is Good.

hook.text: Zero inflation sounds ideal. Economists say it would actually be dangerous.

buildup.text: Mild inflation encourages spending and investment. Why hold cash if it slowly loses value?

discovery.text: It also makes debts easier to repay. You borrow today's dollars, repay with cheaper future dollars.

twist.text: Inflation gives central banks room to cut interest rates during recessions. Zero inflation means no room.

climax.text: The 2% target is a buffer â€” enough to keep the economy moving without causing damage.

punchline.text: A little inflation keeps the engine running.

quiz.question: Why do central banks target about 2% inflation?
options: It encourages spending and gives room to cut rates in downturns
